stream_context.summary: Kaze livestreams the block-out and technical setup of the retro sub-stage “Board the Platforms”, inspired by Smash 64, while simultaneously testing a new multi-stream setup to Twitch and YouTube.
level: Course 11 (Oily Boily Bay) – Retro Sub-stage “Board the Platforms”

development_findings.summary: Retro sub-stage list is nearly complete; remaining four will be Board the Platforms (Smash 64 in 3D), Mario Paint, Dr. Mario, and Mario Land 1.

Current work focuses on building the Smash-style background: three concentric layers of semi-transparent squares drawn on a high-poly sky sphere to reproduce the N64 look while keeping over-draw acceptable.
development_findings.quote: We’re going to have one layer of the white squares, one of the green, one of the blue, all actually in 3D space—high-quality version of the Smash background.

development_findings.summary: Performance is managed by culling unseen polygons and avoiding full-screen over-draw; transparency is tested in Fast64 to match N64 hardware limits.
Implemented custom geo-rotation nodes in Fast64 to let each square layer spin at different speeds/directions; wrote GeoASM script ‘geo_rotate_smash_background’.
Discovered memory bug in level (lava-bubble model spawning in a pipe) and suspects level segment near memory limit; planning to remove unused object banks to free RAM.
Added sixteen surface types (grass, water, stone, creaky wood, snow, sand, ice, mud, wood, steel, glass, leaves, squishy, grates, etc.) for richer footstep/physics feedback.
Camera got a minor redesign after viewer feedback: slower initial D-pad adjustment with gentle acceleration, keeping the feature usable for both fine tweaks and full rotation.
development_findings.quote: I changed the curve so even a four-frame tap is consistent; it still accelerates if you hold it.

development_findings.summary: Planned remaining main courses: Wild West Valley (bounty-style bosses), an undecided music-themed world, an oversized casino, and a comic-book skyscraper city.
development_findings.quote: We actually only have four level themes left… Wild West Valley, maybe a music level, an oversized casino, and a comic-based world.

development_findings.summary: Badub has already composed tracks for all areas shown to date, including the new outside section of Oily Boily Bay.
Target release window is still ‘hopefully 2024’ but not guaranteed.
development_findings.quote: Game of the year 2024— I hope I can release it 2024, I don’t actually know.

context_findings.summary: Kaze has returned to Twitch via Restream because he found an ad-blocker; enjoys pitting YouTube and Twitch chats against each other for engagement.
context_findings.quote: The reason I went back to Twitch—I found an ad blocker. If I hadn’t, Twitch would be dead to me.

key_stories.title: Recreating Smash 64 Background
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants the retro stage to visually match Smash 64’s Board the Platforms. Initial attempts with simple planes looked wrong, so he pivoted to projecting colored squares onto a 3-D sky sphere and writing custom rotation code.
key_stories.challenge: First mock-up with flat quads looked too sharp and performance-heavy.
key_stories.process: Built a high-poly sphere, UV-painted square patterns, wrote ‘geo_rotate_smash_background’ to spin three layers at different speeds.
key_stories.outcome: Achieved authentic look with acceptable performance; still tweaking fade at sphere bottom.
key_stories.key_quote: It’s going to look like the Smash background but a lot better—a high-quality version of this.

key_stories.title: Camera Fine-Tuning via Live Feedback
key_stories.summary: Viewers said small D-pad nudges felt inconsistent. On-stream, Kaze re-balanced base velocity and acceleration, re-compiled, and live-tested until micro-adjustments felt smooth.
key_stories.challenge: Small taps moved camera unevenly, frustrating precision players.
key_stories.process: Adjusted parameters in RTYI camera code (base = 0.75, lower accel), re-built several times.
key_stories.outcome: Settled on values that satisfy both casual full-rotation and pro fine-tuning use cases.
key_stories.key_quote: Even if you need four frames, it’s still a consistent length—let’s try this.
